info.title: Weavr Multi Product API
info.description:
Weavr Multi API provides a simple and flexible way to issue cards and accounts to your customers.

By integrating Weavr Multi API in your application you can embed banking capabilities within your app and provide a seamless experience for your customers.

# Authentication
Each request to the Multi API must include an `api_key` that represents your account. You can obtain an API Key by registering for a Multi account [here](https://portal.weavr.io).

Almost all endpoints require a secondary authentication token `auth_token` that represents the user for whom the request is being executed.

tags.name: Additional Factors
tags.description: Manage additional strong customer authentication factors for your users.

tags.name: Authorised Users
tags.description:
Corporate and Consumer identities can invite authorised users to access their account. Once on-boarded, authorised users can create and manage instruments and transactions on behalf of the identity they are on-boarded with.

In case of **Corporate Identities**, authorised users are typically employees who have access to company's banking products such as cards and bank accounts.

In case of **Consumer Identities**, authorised users are typically children/teens whose parents want them to have access to banking products such as cards and bank accounts.

Note that `/users` endpoints are to be used only for performing operations related to authorised users - getting or updating the details of _root_ users is to be done via the respective `/consumers` or `/corporates` endpoints.

tags.name: Corporates
tags.description: Corporates are identities representing companies. Once on-boarded, Corporates can create and manage their own instruments via your application.

tags.name: Consumers
tags.description: Consumers are identities representing individuals. Once on-boarded, Consumers can create and manage their own instruments via your application.

tags.name: Managed Accounts
tags.description:
Managed Accounts are a type of financial instrument offered by Weavr.

They hold funds for their owner, and can be upgraded to IBANs so as to receive and send funds to instruments outside of the Weavr Platform, via Wire Transfers.

Managed accounts can also be used as source and destination instruments in the `transfer` and `send` transactions.

tags.name: Managed Cards
tags.description:
Managed Cards are a type of financial instrument offered by Weavr.

You can create virtual or physical cards that are issued to the consumer or corporate identity.

A card created in prepaid mode has its own balance, whereas a card created in debit mode does not have its own balance but taps into the balance of its parent managed account.

tags.name: Sends
tags.description: The Send transaction is used to send funds between managed accounts and managed cards belonging to different identities.

tags.name: Transfers
tags.description: The Transfer transaction is used to transfer funds between managed accounts and managed cards belonging to same identity.

tags.name: Outgoing Wire Transfers
tags.description: The Outgoing Wire Transfer transaction is used to transfer funds from managed accounts to an external bank account.

tags.name: Beneficiary Management
tags.description:
Manage a list of beneficiaries for Outgoing wire transfers and Sends. 

Aside from convenience and a reduced chance of making errors when making transactions, 
this allows for the introduction an SCA exemption, where the account holder can request 
that transactions to `TRUSTED` beneficiaries to be exempted from the requirement to pass 
an SCA challenge every time.

post.description:
Authenticate a user with the `email` and `password` that they provided when registering.

Given that the user credentials are correct, this returns a `token` that can then be used to authorise
other secured operations. In case the password is expired, a temporary `token` is returned, which can be used
solely for updating the password.

The token returned is valid for 5 minutes from last activity.

requestBody.description: Pet object that needs to be added to the store

403.description: The authentication credentials are not found or are incorrect.

get.description: Retrieves all managed accounts belonging to the logged-in identity.

post.description:
Creates a managed account for the consumer or corporate identity.
The Managed Account Profile (configured in the Multi Portal) specified determines the behavior and restrictions that the managed account will have."

requestBody.description: Pet object that needs to be added to the store

get.description: Fetch the managed account identified by the `id` in path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Managed Account.

patch.description: Update the details for the managed account identified by the `id` in the path.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the managed account.

get.description: Returns a list of transactions against the managed account identified by the `id` path parameter, matching the criteria provided in the request.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the managed account.

get.description: Returns a list of transactions against the managed card identified by the `id` path parameter, matching the criteria provided in the request.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of a managed card.

parameters.name: orderByTimestamp
parameters.description:
Orders the result in ascending or descending order.
  - ASC: Ascending order, oldest transactions first.
  - DESC: Descending order, most recent transactions first.

If not specified, the transactions will be returned in descending order.

parameters.name: fromTimestamp
parameters.description: Filter for transactions having transaction timestamp after `fromTimestamp`. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision.

parameters.name: toTimestamp
parameters.description: Filter for transactions having transaction timestamp before the `toTimestamp`. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision.

api_key.description: The API Key representing your Multi account. You can find your API Key in your Multi Portal in the API Credentials page.
api_key.name: api-key

auth_token.description: The authentication token representing the user. This will be included in the login response object.

webhooks_key.description: The Webhooks key can be found in the API Credentials tab in your Portal Page.
webhooks_key.name: webhooks-key

published-timestamp.name: published-timestamp
published-timestamp.description: The timestamp, expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision, when this event was published.

signature.name: signature
signature.description: The signature to verify the authenticity of this request.  This is the base64 hash (HmacSHA256) of the `published-timestamp` using your API key.

channel.name: channel
channel.description: The unique identifier for the channel.

userId.name: user_id
userId.description: The user id for which this password is created.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: The offset value for paging, indicating the initial item number to be returned from the data set satisfying the given criteria. Leave out to fetch the first page of results.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The limit of the results for paging, starting at the offset. Limit is always capped at 100.

active.name: active
active.description: Filter for active or deactivated users. Leave out to fetch all users.

email.name: email
email.description: Filter by the email address of the user.

userIdExplode.name: user_id
userIdExplode.description: The unique identifier for the user.

idempotency-ref.name: idempotency-ref
idempotency-ref.description: A unique call reference generated by the caller that, taking into consideration the payload as well as the operation itself, helps avoid duplicate operations. Idempotency reference uniqueness is maintained for at least 24 hours.

profileId.name: profileId
profileId.description: Filter by the managed account/card profile. Leave out to fetch all managed accounts/card.

friendlyName.name: friendlyName
friendlyName.description:
Filter by the managed account/card friendly name. Leave out to fetch all managed accounts/card.

The exact name must be provided, as wildcards are not supported.

currency.name: currency
currency.description:
Filter by the managed account/card currency.

Currencies are expressed as an ISO 4217 code. Leave out to fetch all managed accounts/card.

createdFrom.name: createdFrom
createdFrom.description: Filter for managed accounts/cards created after `createdFrom` timestamp. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision. Leave out to fetch all managed accounts/cards.

createdTo.name: createdTo
createdTo.description: Filter for managed accounts/cards created before `createdTo` timestamp. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision. Leave out to fetch all managed accounts/cards.

tag.name: tag
tag.description: Filter by the managed account/card tag. The exact tag must be provided, as wildcards are not supported. Leave out to fetch all managed accounts/card.

accept.name: accept
accept.description:
A request parameter specifying the type of response the client would like. Must be one of `application/json`, `application/pdf` or `text/csv`.

The default response type (`application/json`) will be returned if specified incorrectly or not specified.

orderByTimestamp.name: orderByTimestamp
orderByTimestamp.description:
Orders the result in ascending or descending order.
  - ASC: Ascending order, oldest transactions first.
  - DESC: Descending order, most recent transactions first.

If not specified, the transactions will be returned in descending order.

fromTimestamp.name: fromTimestamp
fromTimestamp.description: Filter for transactions having transaction timestamp after `fromTimestamp`. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision. Leave out to fetch all managed accounts.

toTimestamp.name: toTimestamp
toTimestamp.description: Filter for transactions having transaction timestamp before `toTimestamp`. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision. Leave out to fetch all managed accounts.

showFundMovementsOnly.name: showFundMovementsOnly
showFundMovementsOnly.description: Returns only the entries which contain fund movements.

card_type.name: type
card_type.description: Filter by the type of the card.

transferProfileId.name: profileId
transferProfileId.description: Filter by the transfer profile. Leave out to fetch all transfer transactions.

instrumentId.name: instrumentId
instrumentId.description: Filter by the source instrument id.

transactionState.name: state
transactionState.description: Filter by the transfer transaction state. Leave out to fetch all states.

transferCreatedFrom.name: createdFrom
transferCreatedFrom.description: Filter for transfer transactions created after `createdFrom` timestamp. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision. Leave out to fetch all transfers.

transferCreatedTo.name: createdTo
transferCreatedTo.description: Filter for transfer transactions created before `createdTo` timestamp. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision. Leave out to fetch all transfers.

transferExecutedFrom.name: executedFrom
transferExecutedFrom.description: Filter for transfer transactions executed after `executedFrom` timestamp. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision. Leave out to fetch all transfers.

transferExecutedTo.name: executedTo
transferExecutedTo.description: Filter for transfer transactions executed before `executedTo` timestamp. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision. Leave out to fetch all transfers.

transferTag.name: tag
transferTag.description: Filter by the transfer tag. The exact tag must be provided, as wildcards are not supported. Leave out to fetch all entries.

sendProfileId.name: profileId
sendProfileId.description: Filter by the Send profile. Leave out to fetch all entries.

sourceId.name: source.id
sourceId.description: Filter by the source instrument id. Must be specified when `source.type` is provided.

sourceType.name: source.type
sourceType.description: Filter by the source instrument type. Must be specified when `source.id` is provided.

sendState.name: state
sendState.description: Filter by the Send transaction state. Leave out to fetch all states.

sendCreatedFrom.name: createdFrom
sendCreatedFrom.description: Filter for send transactions created after `createdFrom` timestamp. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision. Leave out to fetch all Send transactions.

sendCreatedTo.name: createdTo
sendCreatedTo.description: Filter for send transactions created before `createdTo` timestamp. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision. Leave out to fetch all Send transactions.

sendExecutedFrom.name: executedFrom
sendExecutedFrom.description: Filter for send transactions executed after `executedFrom` timestamp. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision. Leave out to fetch all Send transactions.

sendExecutedTo.name: executedTo
sendExecutedTo.description: Filter for send transactions executed before `executedTo` timestamp. Timestamp is expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision. Leave out to fetch all Send transactions.

sendTag.name: tag
sendTag.description: Filter by the send tag. The exact tag must be provided, as wildcards are not supported. Leave out to fetch all entries.

owtInstrument.name: instrument
owtInstrument.description: Filter by the source instrument id (which must be a managed account).

sourceInstrument_id.name: sourceInstrument.id
sourceInstrument_id.description: Filter by the source instrument id. Must be specified when `source.type` is provided.

sourceInstrument_type.name: sourceInstrument.type
sourceInstrument_type.description: Filter by the source instrument type. Must be specified when `source.id` is provided.

owtState.name: state
owtState.description: Filter by the outgoing wire transfer state. Leave out to fetch all states.

identity_id.name: identity.id
identity_id.description: Filter by the source instrument id. Must be specified when `source.type` is provided.

identity_type.name: identity.type
identity_type.description: Filter by the source instrument type. Must be specified when `source.id` is provided.

request-ref.name: request-ref
request-ref.description: A unique call reference included in every call, that enables the receiver to avoid duplicate handling of a webhook request (e.g. webhook was resent).

friendlyName.description: The friendly name to be given to the managed account.

purpose.description: The friendly name to be given to the managed account.

VerificationCode.description: A randomly generated one-time use code used to verify the user's email address or mobile number.

ManufacturingState.description:
Information on the manufacturing of the physical card, as follows:
  - REQUESTED: The upgrade of the card to physical has been requested.
  - SENT_FOR_FULFILLMENT - The card has been sent for printing.
  - DISPATCHED: The card has been manufactured and dispatched.
  - DELIVERED: The card has been received and activated by the recipient.

cardId.description: The unique identifier of the card on which an authorisation is being performed

transactionId.description: The id of this transaction, for reference.

authorisationType.description: The type of authorisation (Debit or Credit)

sourceAmount.description: The amount in the currency of the merchant.

transactionAmount.description: The amount in the currency of the card.

totalTransactionCost.description: The total amount to be deducted in the currency of the card. This is the summation of the transaction amount, forex padding and forex fees.

transactionTimestamp.description: The timestamp of the transaction, using epoch timestamp with millisecond precision.

cardholderPresent.description: Optional detail indicating if the card holder was present when the authorisation occurred.

cardPresent.description: Optional detail indicating if the card was present when the authorisation occurred.

authCode.description: The authorisation code associated with this authorisation.

forexPadding.description: The forex padding amount, if any, that has been included in the transactionAmount.  Forex padding is extra amount blocked to cater for currency fluctuation.

forexFee.description: The forex fee, if set, that is included in the transactionAmount.

mode.description:
The card can be created in prepaid mode or debit mode.

- A prepaid mode card has its own balance and can have funds transferred to or from it.
- A debit mode card does not have its own balance but will be able to spend funds belonging to its parent managed account, subject to a configurable spend limit.

SCAOtpChannel.description: - "SMS": The one-time-password is sent as a text message

SCAPushChannel.description:
- "AUTHY": The push notification is sent on the user's device using [Twilio Authy](https://www.twilio.com/authy)
- "BIOMETRIC": The push notification is sent to the user's device

AuthSCAPushChannel.description: - "AUTHY": The push notification is sent on the user's device using [Twilio Authy](https://www.twilio.com/authy)

ProfileId.description:
The profile Id which a specific identity, instrument or transaction type is linked to.

Profiles contain configuration and determine behavioral aspects of the newly created transaction, for example, fees that may apply.

You can have one or more profiles linked to your application, and these can be used to drive different behaviors according to your product's needs.

Profile Ids can be found in the Multi Portal, in the API Credentials page.

InstrumentState.description:
The state of the instrument indicating what it can and cannot do as follows:
  - ACTIVE: The instrument is in an active state and can be used in transactions.
  - BLOCKED: The instrument is temporarily blocked and cannot be used. Any funds on the instrument are also frozen. The `blockedReason` provides more information as to why it was blocked.
  - DESTROYED: The instrument has been permanently destroyed. The `destroyReason` provides more information as to why it was destroyed.

BlockedReason.description:
The reason why the instrument has been blocked:
  - USER: The root, or an authorised user, of the identity owning the instrument has temporarily blocked the instrument.
  - SYSTEM: The platform or an administrator of the platform has temporarily blocked the instrument.
  - LOST: The instrument has been blocked because it was marked as lost.

DestroyedReason.description:
The reason why the instrument has been destroyed:
  - SYSTEM: The platform or an administrator of the platform has destroyed the instrument.
  - USER: The root, or an authorised user, of the identity owning the instrument has destroyed the instrument.
  - LOST: The instrument was automatically destroyed as it was marked as lost.
  - STOLEN: The instrument was automatically destroyed as it was marked as stolen.
  - EXPIRED: The instrument was automatically destroyed as it expired.

Currency.description: The currency expressed in ISO-4217 code. Example: GBP, EUR, USD.

SendState.description:
The state of the send transaction, as follows:
 - INVALID: The send transaction has failed initial validation checks. 
 - INITIALISED: The initial state of a send transaction when SCA is not required.
 - PENDING_CHALLENGE: The send transaction requires verification before it can be initialised. Use the /sends/{id}/challenges/otp/{channel} API endpoint to start the verification process.
 - PENDING: The send transaction has exceeded the destination limit and is pending treasury approval.
 - APPROVED: The send transaction was approved.
 - COMPLETED: The send transaction has been completed.
 - REJECTED: The send transaction was rejected.
 - FAILED: There was an issue with the send transaction, and the transaction has failed.
 - SCHEDULED: The send transaction will be executed at the scheduled time.
 - CANCELLED: The scheduled send transaction has been cancelled.

OutgoingWireTransferState.description:
The state of the Outgoing wire transfer transaction, as follows:
  - INVALID: The wire transfer has failed initial validation checks.
  - PENDING_CHALLENGE: The wire transfer requires verification before it can be submitted. _Use the `/outgoing_wire_transfers/{id}/challenges/otp/{channel}` API endpoint to start the verification process._
  - SUBMITTED: The wire transfer has been initiated over the selected route.
  - REJECTED: The wire transfer submitted was rejected.
  - APPROVED: The wire transfer submission was approved.
  - FAILED: There was an issue with the wire transfer, and the transaction has failed.
  - COMPLETED: The requested funds have been sent from the source instrument.
  - RETURNED: The wire transfer has been returned to the sender
  - SCHEDULED: The wire transfer will be executed at the scheduled time.
  - CANCELLED: The scheduled wire transfer has been cancelled.

SensitivePassword.description: A randomly generated one-time use code.

Nonce.description: A randomly generated one-time use code.

MultipleSCAResourceType.description: The operation type upon which an SCA Challenge is being contested.

countryCode.description: The country code of the user mobile number (e.g. +44).

number.description: The mobile number of the user - excluding country code.

Tag.description: The tag field is a custom field that can be used to search and filter.

CompanyPosition.description: The company position of the Corporate Root User.

CompanyType.description: Supported company types - if company type is not listed, please contact our support team to check if the company type can be supported.

addressLine1.description: The first line of the address.

addressLine2.description: The second line of the address.

postCode.description: The post cost associated with the address.

country.description: The country of the address expressed in ISO 3166 alpha-2 format.

feeType.description: The fee type as defined in the Multi Portal.

source.description: The instrument from where the fee should be deducted.

AddressWithCountryRequired.description: The address, with none of the separate fields being set as required.

addressLine1.description: The first line of the address.

addressLine2.description: The second line of the address.

postCode.description: The post cost associated with the address.

country.description: The country of the address expressed in ISO 3166 alpha-2 format.

Nationality.description: Nationality of the user - using ISO 3166 alpha-2.

KycLevel.description:
The KYC level, which determines what KYC information will be requested from the consumer:
  - KYC_LEVEL_1: The most basic level of KYC required. 
  - KYC_LEVEL_2: Full due diligence level 2

friendlyName.description: The friendly name for the card.

nameOnCard.description:
The card holder's name for the card.

This may be verified by merchants when the card is used online. For Physical cards, this field will be printed on the card.
The maximum characters allowed will depend on the design chosen and will be provided to you by Weavr when setting up your plastic cards.

nameOnCardLine2.description: Line 2 of the 'name on card' field. For Physical cards, this field will be printed on the card. The maximum characters allowed will depend on the design chosen and will be provided to you by Weavr when setting up your plastic cards.

cardholderMobileNumber.description:
The mobile number including country code of the card holder.

For transactions that require a 3DS challenge, an SMS with a code will be sent on this number, to be entered during an online purchase.

billingAddress.description: The billing address set for the card holder. This may be verified by merchants when the card is used online.

authForwardingDefaultTimeoutDecision.description: Default decision for auth forwarding on timeout

mode.description:
The card can be created in prepaid mode or debit mode.

- A prepaid mode card has its own balance and can have funds transferred to or from it.
- A debit mode card does not have its own balance but will be able to spend funds belonging to its parent managed account, subject to a configurable spend limit.

DeliveryAddress.description: The delivery address where the physical card is delivered.

country.description: Country of the identity in ISO 3166 alpha-2 format.

DeliveryMethod.description: The delivery methods supported for delivering printed physical cards. If not specified, the STANDARD_DELIVERY method will be used.

pushProvisioningEnabled.description: Indicates whether the card is enabled for push provisioning in a digital wallet.

walletsEnabled.description: Indicates whether the card is enabled for tokenisation in a digital wallet.

artworkReference.description: The artwork reference that will be used if the card is enabled for tokenisation in a digital wallet.

linkedUserId.description: The Authorised user whose authentication / billing details will be reflected on the card for verification purposes such as 3ds.

minTransactionAmount.description: The minimum transaction amount, in card currency, that is allowed. If the transaction amount is less than this value, then the transaction will be declined.

maxTransactionAmount.description: The maximum transaction amount, in card currency, that is allowed. If the transaction amount is greater than this value, then the transaction will be declined.

SensitivePin.description:
The PIN used for in-person transactions done with physical cards.

Unless you are PCI-DSS compliant and have opted to switch off Weavr's security model, the card's PIN will be tokenised.

To show the PIN to your user, you need to embed the Display Card PIN UI Component in your application. This accepts the tokenised PIN and shows the plain text PIN to the user on screen.

amount.description:
The monetary amount, scaled to the lowest denomination of the currency.

Example, an amount of 1000 for a EUR currency is actually 1000 Euro cents or EUR 10.00.

CurrencyAmount.description: The object representing a monetary amount in a particular currency.

ScheduledTimestamp.description: The epoch timestamp at which the transaction is scheduled to be executed.

cancellations.description: Contains the details of the transactions to be cancelled.

description.description: The description details that are passed to the beneficiary.

sends.description: The object representing the sends' details.

sourceInstrument.description: The managed account from which funds will be collected.

transferAmount.description: The amount, in same currency as source and destination, that was transferred from the source.

description.description:
These details are passed to the beneficiary as the `reference` and the allowed length is dependent on the payment type:

`SEPA` and `SWIFT` <= `35` characters

`Faster Payments` <= `18` characters

outgoingWireTransfers.description: The object representing the outgoing wire transfers' details.

trustLevel.description: The value that determines whether a Beneficiary is trusted or not.

group.description: A custom field that can be used to categorise a beneficiary for easier searching and filtering.

beneficiaryInformation.description: The object representing the beneficiary details.

beneficiaryDetails.description: The object representing the beneficiary instrument details.

TokenType.description:
The auth token received can only be used to access the following endpoints:
  - `/identities`
  - `/access_token`

SyntaxError.description: Is returned as part of an HTTP error response whenever a syntax error is detected. A list of the fields together with their syntax error will be provided.

TokenError.description: The used token is expired or not found

id.description: The unique identifier of the Corporate Identity.

PasswordInfo.description: Additional information related to the user's password.

identityId.description: The identity to which the user's password information belongs to.

expiryDate.description: The millisecond timestamp indicating when the password will expire. If 0, then this password will not expire.

token.description: An authorisation token to be used in the Authorization header for secured operations.

id.description: The unique identifier of the user.

identity.description: The identity that the user belongs to.

name.description: The first name of the user.

surname.description: The last name of the user.

active.description: The state of the user. If the `active` attribute is false, then the user will not be able to log in.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth of the authorised user.

rootUser.description: The root user of the Corporate Identity.

id.description: The unique identifier of the Corporate Identity.

rootUser.description: The root user of the Corporate Identity.

name.description: The registered name of the company.

businessAddress.description: The address where the business is based.

countryOfRegistration.description: The country of company registration in ISO 3166 alpha-2.

sourceOfFundsOther.description: Description of source of funds in case `OTHER` was chosen.

acceptedTerms.description: Must be set to *true* to indicate that the root user has accepted the terms and conditions.

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the user doing the registration.

feeGroup.description: Fee groups allow the possibility to charge different fees to users under the same profile. If fee groups are not required, ignore this field.

creationTimestamp.description: The time when the Corporate was created, expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision.

transactionId.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

profileId.description: The profile Id which a specific identity, instrument or transaction type is linked to.

feeType.description: The fee type as defined in the Multi Portal, and as sent in the request.

availableBalanceAdjustment.description: The object representing a monetary amount in a particular currency.

id.description: The unique identifier of the Consumer Identity.

rootUser.description: The root user of the Consumer Identity.

creationTimestamp.description: The time when this consumer was created, expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision.

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the consumer user doing the registration.

acceptedTerms.description: Must be set to *true* to indicate that the consumer root user has accepted the terms and conditions.

feeGroup.description: The fee group which the consumer is bound to.

sourceOfFundsOther.description: Description of source of funds in case `OTHER` was chosen.

id.description: The unique identifier of a Managed Account.

friendlyName.description: The friendly name given to the managed account.

creationTimestamp.description: The time when the managed account was created, expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision.

state.description:
The state of the Managed Account's IBAN as follows:
  - UNALLOCATED: The Managed Account has never been assigned an IBAN. Use the _managedAccountsIBANUpgrade_ operation to assign an IBAN to a Managed Account.
  - PENDING_ALLOCATION: The IBAN is being allocated to the Managed Account.
  - ALLOCATED: An IBAN is allocated to the Managed Account.

bankAccountDetails.description:
A list of bank account details associated with the IBAN.
Multiple details can be provided if multiple IBAN providers are supported by your payment model.

beneficiaryNameAndSurname.description: The beneficiary name and surname details to be used when initiating a deposit onto the IBAN.

beneficiaryBank.description: The beneficiary bank name to be used when initiating a deposit onto the IBAN.

beneficiaryBankAddress.description: The beneficiary bank address to be used when initiating a deposit onto the IBAN.

paymentReference.description:
A reference required by the partner bank to execute a deposit on the managed account.


If provided, make sure that this is included as part of the wire transfer details when initiating a deposit.

details.description:
The bank details required to initiate a deposit on the managed account.

The details required to deposit on the IBAN vary depending on the wire transfer channel that will be used.

count.description: The total number of records (excluding the paging limit).

responseCount.description: The total number of records returned in this response.

transactionId.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

originalAmount.description:
The transaction amount as originally requested. The original amount currency may be different from the currency of the instrument.

In case of purchases, this will indicate the original currency and amount that the merchant requested.

forexRate.description: If the `originalAmount` is in a different currency from the instrument's currency, the forex rate used will be provided.

transactionAmount.description: The transaction amount in the instrument's currency.

availableBalanceAdjustment.description: The amount of funds credited or debited on the available balance of the instrument.

actualBalanceAdjustment.description: The amount of funds credited or debited on the actual balance of the instrument.

balanceAfter.description: The balance of the instrument after the transaction was executed.

availableBalanceAfter.description: The available balance of the instrument after the transaction was executed.

actualBalanceAfter.description: The actual balance of the instrument after the transaction was executed.

transactionFee.description: The fee amount that was captured for you (Multi account owner). You can set fees to be taken during transactions in the Multi Portal.

cardholderFee.description: The fee amount that was captured for you (Multi account owner). You can set fees to be taken during transactions in the Multi Portal. This field is deprecated - use `transactionFee` instead.

processedTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the transaction was processed by the system, expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision.

sourceAmount.description: The source amount of the transaction, if the transaction involves forex.

additionalFields.description: A Map of additional fields. Possible values include fee information. The possible entries are `merchantName`, `merchantCategoryCode`, `merchantTerminalCountry`, `sourceInstrumentType`, `sourceInstrumentId`, `destinationInstrumentType`, `destinationInstrumentId`, `forexPaddingCurrency`, `forexPaddingAmount`, `note`, `sourceInstrumentFriendlyName`, `destinationInstrumentFriendlyName`, `sourceIdentityType`, `sourceIdentityId`, `sourceIdentityName`, `destinationIdentityType`, `destinationIdentityId`, `destinationIdentityName`, `exchangeRate`, `authorisationState`, `authorisationRelatedId`, `settlementRelatedId`, `chargeFeeType`, `relatedTransactionId`, `relatedTransactionIdType`, `beneficiaryName`, `beneficiaryAccount`, `beneficiaryBankCode`, `merchantId`, `merchantTransactionType`, `systemTransactionType`, `authorisationCode`, `relatedCardId`, `sender`, `forexFeeCurrency`, `forexFeeAmount`, `senderIban`, `senderReference`, `mandateId`, `merchantReference`, `description`, `declineReason` and `spendRuleFailedReason`.

id.description: The unique identifier of the card.

externalHandle.description:
A uniquely generated code used to identify a card.

This code is to be used instead of the sensitive card number in order to refer to a card when opening a support ticket.

friendlyName.description: The friendly name given to the card.

type.description:
The type of card:
  - VIRTUAL: Not a printed or embedded card. The card can be used online or added to digital wallets.
  - PHYSICAL: A physical card that can be printed and shipped to your customers or embedded in a Wearable device. It can be used at physical terminals.

cardBrand.description: The card scheme, or brand of the card.

cardNumberFirstSix.description: The first six digits of the card number.

cardNumberLastFour.description: The last four digits of the card number.

nameOnCard.description: The card holder’s name for the card. This may be verified by merchants when the card is used online. For Physical cards, this field will be printed on the card. The maximum characters allowed will depend on the design chosen and will be provided to you by Weavr when setting up your plastic cards.

nameOnCardLine2.description: Line 2 of the 'name on card' field. For Physical cards, this field will be printed on the card. The maximum characters allowed will depend on the design chosen and will be provided to you by Weavr when setting up your plastic cards.

startMmyy.description: The start date of this card, in MMYY format.

expiryMmyy.description: The end date of this card, in MMYY format.

cardLevelClassification.description: The card classification determines whether the card is from Consumer or Corporate BINs.

expiryPeriodMonths.description: The validity timeframe of the card, in months.

renewalType.description:
Indicates how card will be handled once it is close to expiring.
  - AUTO_RENEW: The card will be automatically renewed, keeping the same card number but with a new expiry date and CVV.
  - NO_RENEW: Once the expiry date is reached, the card is destroyed.

creationTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the card was created, expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision.

cardholderMobileNumber.description: The mobile number including country code of the card holder, needed for 3DS challenge.

billingAddress.description: The billing address set for the cardholder. This can be checked by the merchant during online purchases.

authForwardingDefaultTimeoutDecision.description: Default decision for auth forwarding on timeout

mode.description:
The mode with which this card was created:

- A prepaid mode card has its own balance and can have funds transferred to or from it.
- A debit mode card does not have its own balance but will be able to spend funds belonging to its parent managed account, subject to a configurable spend limit.

allowedMerchantCategories.description: Whitelist MCC: A list of allowed merchant category codes (MCCs). If the MCC does not match, then the transaction will be declined. If an MCC is also in the blocked list, the blocked list will take precedence. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."allowedMerchantCategories" instead.

blockedMerchantCategories.description: Blacklist MCC: A list of disallowed merchant category codes (MCCs). If the MCC matches, then the transaction will be declined. If an MCC is also in the allowed list, the blocked list will take precedence. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."blockedMerchantCategories" instead.

allowedMerchantIds.description: Whitelist Merchant Id: A list of allowed merchant IDs. If the Merchant Id does not match, then the transaction will be declined. If a Merchant Id is also provided in the blocked list, the blocked list will take precedence. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."allowedMerchantIds" instead.

blockedMerchantIds.description: Blacklist Merchant Id: A list of disallowed merchant IDs. If the Merchant Id matches, then the transaction will be declined. If a Merchant Id is also in the allowed list, the blocked list will take precedence. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."blockedMerchantIds" instead.

allowedMerchantCountries.description: Whitelist Merchant Country: A list of allowed merchant countries, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format. If the Merchant country does not match, then the transaction will be declined. If a Merchant Country is also provided in the blocked list, the blocked list will take precedence. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."allowedMerchantCountries" instead.

blockedMerchantCountries.description: Blacklist Merchant Country: A list of disallowed merchant countries, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format. If the Merchant country matches, then the transaction will be declined. If a Merchant Country is also in the allowed list, the blocked list will take precedence. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."blockedMerchantCountries" instead.

allowContactless.description: Indicates if a contactless transaction is allowed on the card. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."allowContactless" instead.

allowAtm.description: Indicates if an ATM Withdrawal transaction is allowed on the card. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."allowAtm" instead.

allowECommerce.description: Indicates if an online transaction is allowed on the card. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."allowECommerce" instead.

allowCashback.description: Indicates if a cashback transaction at a physical terminal is allowed on the card. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."allowCashback" instead.

allowCreditAuthorisations.description: Indicates if a the card can receive a credit transaction. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."allowCashback" instead.

minTransactionAmount.description: The minimum transaction amount, in card currency, that is allowed. If the transaction amount is less than this value, then the transaction will be declined. Omit this, or set to 0 if no maximum transaction amount is to be set. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."minTransactionAmount" instead.

maxTransactionAmount.description: The maximum transaction amount, in card currency, that is allowed. If the transaction amount is greater than this value, then the transaction will be declined. Omit this, or set to 0 if no maximum transaction amount is to be set. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."maxTransactionAmount" instead.

spendLimit.description: The total amount of funds that can be spent using this card, in a given time interval. This field is deprecated - use "cardLevelSpendRules"."spendLimit" instead.

id.description: The unique identifier of a Transfer transaction.

source.description: The source managed account or card from where the funds were transferred.

destination.description: The destination managed account or card to where the funds were transferred.

destinationAmount.description: The amount, in same currency as source and destination, that was transferred from the source to the destination instrument.

description.description: The description details that are included in the transaction as reference.

creationTimestamp.description: The time when the transaction was created, expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision.

cancellations.description: Contains the cancellation details for each of the transactions.

id.description: The unique identifier of a send transaction.

source.description: The source managed account or card from where the funds were sent.

destination.description: The destination managed account or card to where the funds were sent.

destinationAmount.description: The amount, in same currency as source and destination, that was sent from the source to the destination instrument.

description.description: The description details that are passed to the beneficiary.

creationTimestamp.description: The time when the transaction was created, expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision.

id.description: The unique identifier of a send transaction.
The unique identifier of an Outgoing Wire Transfer transaction.

sourceInstrument.description: The source managed account from where the funds were taken.

transferAmount.description: The amount, in same currency as source and destination, that was transferred from the source.

creationTimestamp.description: The time when the transaction was created, expressed in Epoch timestamp using millisecond precision.

id.description: The unique identifier of an outgoing wire transfer transaction.
The unique identifier of a Beneficiary.

relatedOperationBatches.description: The object representing the list of batch IDs and the operations that occurred for each batch.

merchantName.description: The name of the merchant where the authorisation has been made.

availableBalance.description: The card available balance before this authorisation is processed.

parentManagedAccountId.description: Id of the managed account holding funds which the managed card can access, up to a configurable spend limit.

availableToSpend.description: The amount of funds from the parent managed account that are available to be spent through the card, in a given time interval, _before_ this transaction is performed.

parentManagedAccountId.description: Id of the managed account holding funds which the managed card will access, up to a configurable spend limit.

spendLimit.description: The total amount of funds that can be spent using this card, in a given time interval.

OutgoingWireTransferBeneficiary.description: Details of the beneficiary of the outgoing wire transfer.

name.description:
The beneficiary's full name. The allowed length and pattern is dependent on the bank account details type:

`SepaBankDetails`: >= `1` character and <= `150` characters

`FasterPaymentsBankDetails`: >= `1` character and <= `140` characters with a pattern of `^[a-zA-Z0-9\/\-?:().,’+\s#=!"%&*<>;{@\r\n]*$`
(please note that the `’` symbol is the unicode value U+2019 (right single quotation mark) and not the unicode value U+0027 (apostrophe))

bankCountry.description: The beneficiary's bank country in ISO 3166 alpha-2 format.

bankAccountDetails.description: Details of the beneficiary bank account, depending on the type of transfer chosen.

BeneficiaryTrustLevel.description: The value that determines whether a Beneficiary is trusted or not.

businessName.description:
The business beneficiary name. The allowed length and pattern is dependent on the beneficiary details type:

`InstrumentDetailsBeneficiary` or `BankAccountDetailsBeneficiary` with `SepaBankDetails`: >= `1` character and <= `150` characters

`BankAccountDetailsBeneficiary` with `FasterPaymentsBankDetails`: >= `1` character and <= `140` characters with a pattern of `^[a-zA-Z0-9\/\-?:().,’+\s#=!"%&*<>;{@\r\n]*$`
(please note that the `’` symbol is the unicode value U+2019 (right single quotation mark) and not the unicode value U+0027 (apostrophe))

fullName.description:
The person beneficiary name. The allowed length and pattern is dependent on the beneficiary details type:

`InstrumentDetailsBeneficiary` or `BankAccountDetailsBeneficiary` with `SepaBankDetails`: >= `1` character and <= `150` characters

`BankAccountDetailsBeneficiary` with `FasterPaymentsBankDetails`: >= `1` character and <= `140` characters with a pattern of `^[a-zA-Z0-9\/\-?:().,’+\s#=!"%&*<>;{@\r\n]*$`
(please note that the `’` symbol is the unicode value U+2019 (right single quotation mark) and not the unicode value U+0027 (apostrophe))

InstrumentDetailsBeneficiary.description: Represents a Weavr beneficiary instrument typically used in Send transactions.

BankAccountDetailsBeneficiary.description: Represent the beneficiary bank account typically used in Outgoing Wire Transfer transactions.

bankCountry.description: The beneficiary's bank country in ISO 3166 alpha-2 format.

bankAccountDetails.description: Details of the beneficiary bank account, depending on the type of transfer chosen.

SCAChallengeType.description:
- "OTP": The OTP is sent as a text message
- "PUSH": The authorisation request is sent as a push notification
- "BIOMETRIC": The push notification is sent via Firebase to a mobile application

SCAFactorStatus.description:
The state of the factor type.
- `PENDING_VERIFICATION` : The user has started the enrolment process but still hasn't completed enrolment. Challenges cannot be used before they are verified.
- `ACTIVE` : The user has successfully completed enrolment and the challenge can be used to verify transactions.
- `INACTIVE` : The user has rejected the enrolment.

SCAChannel.description:
- "SMS": The one-time-password is sent as a text message
- "AUTHY": The push notification is sent to an Authy application
- "BIOMETRIC": The push notification is sent to an innovator application

passwordAlreadySet.description: When the corporate root user is a single email multiple identities user, this field returns true, indicating that there is no need to call the `passwordCreate` operation for this user.

name.description: First name of the root user.

surname.description: Last name of the root user.

active.description: The state of the root user. If false, then the user will not be able to log in.

emailVerified.description: Indicates if the root user's email has been verified.

mobileNumberVerified.description: Indicates if the root user's mobile number has been verified.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth of the authorised user.

LegalAddress.description: The legal address of the company. This information is captured via the Due Diligence (KYB) process.

country.description: Country of the identity in ISO 3166 alpha-2 format.

name.description: First name of the root user.

surname.description: Last name of the root user.

active.description: The state of the root user. If false, then the user will not be able to log in.

emailVerified.description: Indicates if the root user's email has been verified.

mobileNumberVerified.description: Indicates if the root user's mobile number has been verified.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth of the consumer root user.

address.description: Address of the consumer root user.

nationality.description: Nationality of the consumer root user, in ISO 3166 alpha-2 format.

placeOfBirth.description: The place of birth of the consumer root user.

ManagedInstrumentBalance.description: Instruments with funds have 2 balances, the `availableBalance` indicating the funds that are available for transactions such as purchases, and the `actualBalance` indicating the funds that are actually on the instrument.

availableBalance.description: The funds available for transactions on the instrument. Funds that are blocked or pending are not included in the available balance.

actualBalance.description: The funds that are actually on the instrument. Funds that are blocked or pending, due to for example, a purchase authorisation or a pending deposit, are included in the actual balance.

SepaBankDetails.description: Bank details used in case the wire transfer is executed over SEPA.

iban.description: International Bank Account Number, required for wire transfer over SEPA.

bankIdentifierCode.description: BIC, required for wire transfer over SEPA.

FasterPaymentsBankDetails.description: Bank details used in case the wire transfer is executed over Faster Payments.

accountNumber.description: Account number, required for wire transfer over Faster Payments.

sortCode.description: Sort code, required for wire transfer over Faster Payments.

SwiftBankDetails.description: Bank details used in case the wire transfer is executed over SWIFT.

iban.description: International Bank Account Number, required for wire transfer over SWIFT.

code.description: SWIFT code, identifying a particular bank or branch, required for wire transfer over SWIFT.

StatementEntryState.description:
The transaction entry state, as follows:
  - PENDING: The transaction has started and some of the fund movements have completed, however additional fund movements are still pending to finalise the transaction.
  - COMPLETED: All fund movements for a transaction have completed.

ScaledAmount.description: A floating point number, represented as a value and its scale. Its actual value can be obtained using the equation: value * pow(10, -scale).

SensitiveCardNumber.description:
The full card number of the card.

Unless you are PCI-DSS compliant and have opted to switch off Weavr's security model, the card number will be tokenised.

To show the full unredacted card number to your user, you need to embed the Card number UI Component in your application. This accepts the tokenised card number and shows the unredacted card number to the user on screen.

SensitiveCvv.description:
The CVV of the card.

Unless you are PCI-DSS compliant and have opted to switch off Weavr's security model, the card's CVV will be tokenised.

To show the card's CVV to your user, you need to embed the CVV UI Component in your application. This accepts the tokenised CVV and shows the plain text CVV number to the user on screen.

productReference.description: The unique reference indicating the configuration of the physical card. Example the card design.

pendingActivation.description: Indicates if the physical card is activated for physical usage such as with physical terminals.

pinBlocked.description: Indicates if the physical card is blocked due to providing incorrect PINs.

replacement.description: Indicates if the physical card is replaced by another card.

replacementReason.description:
The reason why the physical card was replaced.
  - DAMAGED: The physical card was damaged and cannot be used at a physical terminal.
  - LOST_STOLEN: The physical card was either lost or stolen and cannot be used.
  - EXPIRED: The physical card expired.

replacementId.description: The unique identifier of the new card that replaces this card.

nameOnCardLine2.description: Line 2 of the 'name on card' field. For Physical cards, this field will be printed on the card. The maximum characters allowed will depend on the design chosen and will be provided to you by Weavr when setting up your plastic cards. This field is deprecated

parentManagedAccountId.description: Id of the managed account holding funds which the managed card will access, up to a configurable spend limit.

availableToSpend.description: The amount of funds from the parent managed account that are available to be spent through the card, in a given time interval.

value.description: The spend limit, as amount and currency, (for the given interval).

authForwardingEnabled.description: Indicates if auth forwarding is enabled on profile level

minTransactionAmount.description: The minimum transaction amount, in card currency, that is allowed. If the transaction amount is less than this value, then the transaction will be declined. Omit this, or set to 0 if no maximum transaction amount is to be set.

maxTransactionAmount.description: The maximum transaction amount, in card currency, that is allowed. If the transaction amount is greater than this value, then the transaction will be declined.

ExecutionTimestamp.description: The epoch timestamp at which the transaction was executed, transitioning to a final state such as COMPLETED, REJECTED, or FAILED.

TransactionCancellationReason.description: The reason the scheduled transaction was cancelled.

errorCode.description:
Indicates the reason why the cancel operation could not be executed.
May be included in the response if the state is "ERROR".

- "GENERIC": A generic error has occurred.
- "TRANSACTION_NOT_SCHEDULED": The transaction is not in state SCHEDULED.
- "FORBIDDEN": The current user is not allowed to access this transaction.
- "NOT_FOUND": The transaction does not exist.

ChallengeExemptionReason.description: The Reason the transaction was exempted from SCA verification

OutgoingWireTransferType.description: The wire transfer rails used, from SEPA, Faster Payments or SWIFT.

OutgoingWireTransferRejectedInfo.description:
Additional info when the outgoing wire transfer has been rejected, as follows:
  - SYSTEM: The wire transfer was rejected by the system.
  - USER: The wire transfer was rejected by the user.

batchId.description: The unique identifier of a Beneficiary.

operation.description: Describes the operation that has occurred on a beneficiary batch.

value.description: The amount and currency that is available to spend, (for the given interval).

allowedMerchantCategories.description: Whitelist MCC: A list of allowed merchant category codes (MCCs). If the MCC does not match, then the transaction will be declined. If an MCC is also in the blocked list, the blocked list will take precedence.

blockedMerchantCategories.description: Blacklist MCC: A list of disallowed merchant category codes (MCCs). If the MCC matches, then the transaction will be declined. If an MCC is also in the allowed list, the blocked list will take precedence.

allowedMerchantIds.description: Whitelist Merchant Id: A list of allowed merchant IDs. If the Merchant Id does not match, then the transaction will be declined. If a Merchant Id is also provided in the blocked list, the blocked list will take precedence.

blockedMerchantIds.description: Blacklist Merchant Id: A list of disallowed merchant IDs. If the Merchant Id matches, then the transaction will be declined. If a Merchant Id is also in the allowed list, the blocked list will take precedence.

allowedMerchantCountries.description: Whitelist Merchant Country: A list of allowed merchant countries, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format. If the Merchant country does not match, then the transaction will be declined. If a Merchant Country is also provided in the blocked list, the blocked list will take precedence.

blockedMerchantCountries.description: Blacklist Merchant Country: A list of disallowed merchant countries, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format. If the Merchant country matches, then the transaction will be declined. If a Merchant Country is also in the allowed list, the blocked list will take precedence.

allowContactless.description: Indicates if a contactless transaction is allowed on the card.

allowAtm.description: Indicates if an ATM Withdrawal transaction is allowed on the card.

allowECommerce.description: Indicates if an online transaction is allowed on the card.

allowCashback.description: Indicates if a cashback transaction at a physical terminal is allowed on the card.

allowCreditAuthorisations.description: Indicates if a the card can receive a credit transaction.

AddressWithNoRequiredFields.description: The address, with none of the separate fields being set as required.

addressLine1.description: The first line of the address.

addressLine2.description: The second line of the address.

postCode.description: The post cost associated with the address.

country.description: The country of the address expressed in ISO 3166 alpha-2 format.

DeliveryTrackingCode.description: The delivery tracking code for tracking the physical card's delivery status.

DeliveryTrackingMethod.description: The delivery tracking method for tracking the physical card's delivery status.

SpendLimitInterval.description:
The time period for which the `spendLimit` is valid.
 - DAILY: starting from 00:00:00 UTC of current day to 23:59:59 UTC of current day
 - WEEKLY: 00:00:00 UTC Monday of current week to following Sunday 23:59:59 UTC
 - MONTHLY: 1st of current calendar month to end of current calendar month
 - QUARTERLY: starting from beginning of current quarter where quarters are defined as follows:
  - 1 January 00:00:00 UTC to 31 March 23:59:59 UTC
  - 1 April 00:00:00 UTC to 30 Jun 23:59:59 UTC
  - 1 July 00:00:00 UTC to 30 September 23:59:59 UTC
  - 1 October 00:00:00 UTC to 31 December 23:59:59 UTC

- YEARLY: 1 January 00:00:00 UTC of current calendar year to 31 December 23:59:59 UTC of current calendar year.
- ALWAYS: This indicates that the `spendLimit` is the total amount that can be spent through the card throughout the whole lifetime of the card.

request-ref.description: A request identifier. Providing this reference when contacting our support team will help us investigate your query.

x-ratelimit-limit.description:
Example: `20, 10;w=60, 20;w=3600, 200;w=86400`
The first number (20) is the limit that has been exceeded.
The remaining numbers are the limits that are in force, with 'w' meaning 'window in seconds'. In this example `20;w=3600` was exceeded. 20 calls in 3600secs (1hr)

x-ratelimit-reset.description: The number of seconds until the window is reset.

verificationCode.description: The code received by the user on the device.

resourceType.description: The resource type that the subsequent Ids pertain to.

verificationCode.description: The code received by the user on the device.

resourceType.description: The resource type that the subsequent Ids pertain to.

name.description: The first name of the user.

surname.description: The last name of the user.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth of the authorised user.

name.description: The first name of the user.

surname.description: The last name of the user.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth of the authorised user.

rootUser.description:
The root user needs to be a director or a legal representative of the corporate that is being onboarded - this user cannot be deactivated.

Root users need to verify their email address and mobile number, as well as complete KYC as part of the Corporate's due diligence process.

name.description: The first name of the root user.

surname.description: The last name of the root user.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth of the root user.

company.description: The details associated with the company being on-boarded. The details provided need to match exactly with the details provided during KYB.

name.description: The registered name of the company.

registrationNumber.description: The registration number of the company.

registrationCountry.description: The country of company registration, in ISO 3166 alpha-2 format.

sourceOfFundsOther.description: Description of source of funds in case `OTHER` was chosen.

acceptedTerms.description: Must be set to *true* to indicate that the corporate root user has accepted the terms and conditions.

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the corporate user doing the registration.

feeGroup.description: Fee groups allow the possibility to charge different fees to users under the same profile. If fee groups are not required, ignore this field.

sourceOfFundsOther.description: Description of source of funds in case `OTHER` was chosen.

feeGroup.description: The fee group which the Corporate will be bound to. Do not specify this if you are not using fee groups.

name.description: The first name of the Corporate root user.

surname.description: The last name of the Corporate root user.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth of the authorised user.

schema.description: The custom fee to be charged to the consumer/corporate.

rootUser.description:
The root user represents the identity.

Root users need to verify their email address and mobile number, as well as complete KYC, as part of the Consumer's due diligence process.

name.description: The first name of the root user.

surname.description: The last name of the root user.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth of the consumer root user.

address.description: Address of the consumer root user.

placeOfBirth.description: Place of birth of the consumer root user.

nationality.description: Nationality of the root user, in ISO 3166 alpha-2 format."

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the user doing the registration.

acceptedTerms.description: Must be set to *true* to indicate that the consumer has accepted the terms and conditions.

feeGroup.description: The fee group which the consumer is bound to. Fee groups provide the possibility of different fees to users under the same profile. If fee groups are not required, ignore this field.

sourceOfFundsOther.description: Description of source of funds in case `OTHER` was chosen.

name.description: The first name of the Consumer root user.

surname.description: The last name of the Consumer root user.

dateOfBirth.description: Date of birth of the consumer root user.

address.description: Address of the consumer root user.

feeGroup.description: The fee group which the consumer will be bound to. Do not specify this if you are not using fee groups.

sourceOfFundsOther.description: Description of source of funds in case `OTHER` was chosen.

placeOfBirth.description: The place of birth of the consumer root user.

nationality.description: Nationality of the consumer root user, in ISO 3166 alpha-2 format.

kycLevel.description: The KYC level that the consumer will be assigned to, which determines the due diligence details that the user will need to provide.

prefillDetails.description: List of KYC details to be prefilled for the consumer.

friendlyName.description: The friendly name to be given to the managed account.
Updates the friendly name of the managed account. Leave blank if no change is needed.
Updates the friendly name of the card. Leave blank if no change is needed.

nameOnCard.description:
The card holder's name for the card.

This may be verified by merchants when the card is used online. For Physical cards, this field will be printed on the card.
The maximum characters allowed will depend on the design chosen and will be provided to you by Weavr when setting up your plastic cards.

nameOnCardLine2.description: Line 2 of the 'name on card' field. For Physical cards, this field will be printed on the card. The maximum characters allowed will depend on the design chosen and will be provided to you by Weavr when setting up your plastic cards.

cardholderMobileNumber.description: The mobile number including country code of the card holder, needed in case a 3DS challenge is required.

billingAddress.description: The billing address of the card holder. Merchants may request the billing address to be checked for online purchases.

deliveryAddress.description: The delivery address set for the card holder. This is only applicable for physical cards.

authForwardingDefaultTimeoutDecision.description: Default decision for auth forwarding on timeout

activationCode.description: The code to be used to activate the physical card. Depending on how the cards were created, this may be a code set upon creation, or it may be the same as the `externalReference`.

friendlyName.description: The friendly name given to the card.

nameOnCard.description: The card holder’s name for the card. This may be verified by merchants when the card is used online. For Physical cards, this field will be printed on the card. The maximum characters allowed will depend on the design chosen and will be provided to you by Weavr when setting up your plastic cards.

nameOnCardLine2.description: Line 2 of the 'name on card' field. For Physical cards, this field will be printed on the card. The maximum characters allowed will depend on the design chosen and will be provided to you by Weavr when setting up your plastic cards.

billingAddress.description: The billing address set for the card holder, required for AVS checking.

cardholderMobileNumber.description: The mobile number including country code of the card holder, needed for 3DS challenge.

authForwardingDefaultTimeoutDecision.description: Default decision for auth forwarding on timeout

productReference.description:
The product design reference to be used for this physical card.

This reference will be given to you once your physical card programme has been set up. If only one card programme is configured, this field can be left empty.

carrierType.description:
The carrier type to be used for this physical card.

This reference will be given to you once your physical card carrier has been set up. If only one carrier is configured, this field can be left empty.

activationCode.description: The unique code to be used to activate the physical card.

nameOnCardLine2.description: Line 2 of the 'name on card' field. For Physical cards, this field will be printed on the card. The maximum characters allowed will depend on the design chosen and will be provided to you by Weavr when setting up your plastic cards. This field is deprecated.

activationCode.description: The code, set up when upgrading the card, that allows the physical card to be activated.
The code that will be used to activate the physical card replacement.
A unique code to be used to activate the replacement physical card.

source.description: The managed account or managed card from where the funds will be transferred.

description.description: The description details that are included in the transaction as reference.

destination.description: The managed account or managed card to where the funds will be transferred.

destinationAmount.description: The amount, in same currency as the source and destination instruments, to be transferred to the destination (exclusive of any fee amount that may be specified in the profile).

beneficiaries.description: The object representing the beneficiaries' details.

token.description: An authorisation token (valid for 5 minutes from last activity) identifying the user to be used in the `auth_token` authorization header for secured operations.

identity.description: The identity to which the logged-in user belongs to.

credentials.description: The unique identifier for the logged-in user.

BadRequestError.description: Bad Request Error - Your request is invalid.

message.description: When present helps to identify and fix the problem.

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized - Your credentials or access token are invalid.

NotFoundToken.description: Not found - The requested token couldn't be found.

LoginWithPasswordConflict.description: The user's password has expired. Use the returned temporary token to update their password via the  '_/passwords/update_' endpoint.

token.description: Temporary authorisation token required to initiate the _passwordUpdate_ operation.

TokenExpired.description: Gone - The requested token is expired.

Locked.description: Locked - Account is temporarily locked due to failed consecutive login attempts. Try again in 30 minutes.

InternalServerError.description: Internal Server Error - There is a problem with the server. Please try again later.

ServiceUnavailable.description: Service Unavailable - We're temporarily offline for maintenance. Please try again later.

challengeId.description: The unique identifier of a Biometric challenge.

schema.description: The list of identities available to user.

Forbidden.description: Forbidden - Access to the requested resource or action is forbidden.

NotFound.description: Not found - The requested resource couldn't be found.

MethodNotAllowed.description: Method Not Allowed - The request was received but has been rejected for the requested resource.

url.description: The logout url for third party auth providers.

token.description: The authorisation token to be used in the Authorization header for secured operations.

factors.description: The list of challenge types the logged-in user is enrolled on.

linkingCode.description: The code to link the device.

InstrumentForbidden.description: Forbidden - Access to the requested resource or action is forbidden.

errorCode.description:
Error codes:
  * `STATE_INVALID` - The operation no longer requires additional verification, it was either cancelled or completed.
  * `CHANNEL_NOT_SUPPORTED` - The channel selected cannot be used to verify this type of operation.
  * `CHANNEL_NOT_REGISTERED` - The channel selected must be enrolled to receive one-time passwords before it can be used to verify this type of operation.

identity.description: The identity to which the logged-in user belongs to.

credentials.description: The unique identifier for the logged-in user.

status.description:
The token status, as follows:
  - STANDARD: it is a standard token. 
  - STEPPED_UP: it is a stepped up token.

users.description: The list of users matching the criteria specified.

count.description: The total number of records (excluding the paging limit).

responseCount.description: The total number of records returned in this response (always capped at 100).

kybStatus.description: The effective due diligence status of the logged-in corporate user.

ongoingKybStatus.description: The ongoing due diligence status of the logged-in corporate user.

reference.description: The reference used to initialise the KYC UI Component.

kycLevel.description: The KYC level assigned to the consumer.

fullDueDiligence.description: The status of the Due Diligence for the consumer.

kycLevel.description: The customer's level of due diligence.

ongoingFullDueDiligence.description: The status of the ongoing Due Diligence process for the consumer

ongoingKycLevel.description: The level of due diligence of the ongoing KYC process.

verificationFlow.description: Name of verification flow, to be provided to Sumsub Mobile SDK.

accessToken.description: The access token, to be provided to Sumsub Mobile SDK.

identityType.description: Type of identity, to be provided to Sumsub Mobile SDK.

kycLevel.description: The KYC level assigned to the consumer.

responseCount.description: The total number of records returned in this response (always capped at 100).

responseCount.description: Total number of records returned in this response.

errorCode.description:
Error codes:
  * `TRANSACTION_LIMIT_EXCEEDED` - The number of transactions exceeds the limit of 1000.

count.description: Total number of records (excluding the paging limit)

responseCount.description: Total number of records returned in this response (always capped at 100).

errorCode.description:
Error codes:
  * `TRANSACTION_LIMIT_EXCEEDED` - The number of transactions exceeds the limit of 1000.

Error codes:
  * `STATE_INVALID` - The transaction no longer requires additional verification, it was either cancelled or completed.
  * `CHANNEL_NOT_SUPPORTED` - The channel selected cannot be used to verify this type of transaction.
  * `CHANNEL_NOT_REGISTERED` - The channel selected must be enrolled to receive one-time passwords before it can be used to verify this type of transaction.
  * `SCA_EXEMPTION_APPLIED` - The transaction no longer requires additional verification, it was proceeded via PSD2 Regulation low value SCA exemption, it is either cancelled or completed.
